alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued July 11 at 8:40PM PDT until July 15 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor tidal overflow of beaches and exposed parking lots around the time of the evening high tide. * WHERE...Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Pooling of sea water is possible around the evening high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. Enhanced beach erosion is also possible. No significant damage is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A high tide of 7.2 to 7.4 feet will occur each evening between about 830 PM PDT and 1030 PM PDT. In addition, and a long-period southerly swell near 2 feet will enhance the tidal overflow risk.
info.instruction: Localized minor coastal flooding is possible over low-lying coastal areas such as beach parking lots and harbor walkways. No significant damage is expected.

area.areaDesc: Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
